solution_line_template: A glass is filled with {glass_capacity} x {fill_fraction} = {water_per_glass} ounces of water.
So, {num_glasses} 6-ounces of glasses contains a total of {water_per_glass} x {num_glasses} = <<{water_per_glass}*{num_glasses}={total_water_current}>>{total_water_current} ounces of water.
To fill the {num_glasses} glasses to the brim, {num_glasses} x {glass_capacity} = <<{num_glasses}*{glass_capacity}={total_capacity}>>{total_capacity} ounces of water are needed.
Hence, {total_capacity} - {total_water_current} = <<{total_capacity}-{total_water_current}={water_needed}>>{water_needed} ounces of water are still needed.
